I am a 42 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a widow and a single father to my son who is now 14 years old. My son has recently started playing Stardew Valley. In less than a week he has already played over 20 hours. It was terrible for me because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son because he was always with his friends or watching YouTube videos. So I decided to create a Steam account to play with my son. I started playing, but it was my first time playing a video game since the 2000s, so I was pretty lost. 

I asked my son for help and we spent a few hours playing together. I loved it, as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife died. Playing video games reminded me that there is fun in everything, and it brought me and my son close again, and now we actually spend time together but then he died... the game is still good :)

Stardew Valley is a farming game with the added layers of developing friendships, mining, cooking, foraging, fishing, crafting, quests completion, and so much more. Players can play single or coop/multiplayer, competitively or casually, with a suggested route of embracing a large corporation or a small town supply store as they play through seasons and years. Relationships with the town inhabitants can be casual, friends, or romantic to marriage and children, with actions and consequences available. Enjoy the play however you like!

Can't believe I have not reviewed this yet but as you can tell from the hours played, it is one of the best games I have ever played. The story is so interesting and can be a challenging game depending on your objectives. It is a game that you get more out of the more you put in. It can be super casual or you can aim for the ending with lots of challenges a long the way.

The amount of secrets and fun ways to interact with items is brilliant. Wonderful replay value and sure it is a game I will come back to forever. I started after the 1.5 update so am unbelievably excited for the next one. Until then I will be making a far more casual farm and watching speed runners compete for how fast they can put a hat on a sea urchin among others things (shout out to SeanieDew).

TLDR; bloody great mate, deffo give it a go. You'll either lose five quid or become fixated on your farm layout.

Rating: ★★★★★

Stardew Valley, the beloved farming simulation game available on Steam, is a delightful escape into a pixelated haven of rural tranquility and heartwarming simplicity. Developed by ConcernedApe, this indie gem has captured the hearts of players worldwide with its enchanting blend of farming, relationships, and exploration.

At its core, Stardew Valley invites players to step away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life and embrace the slower, more fulfilling pace of country living. The game begins with inheriting a run-down farm in the quaint Pelican Town, and from there, players have the freedom to shape their destiny. The diverse activities available, from tending to crops and animals to mining, fishing, and building relationships, provide a sense of purpose and endless possibilities.

The charm of Stardew Valley lies not only in its engaging gameplay but also in its endearing characters and picturesque world. The pixel art style exudes nostalgia, and the changing seasons bring the farm and its surroundings to life with vibrant colors and subtle details. The townspeople each have their unique personalities, stories, and quirks, making them feel like genuine friends in your virtual community.

The game's emphasis on relationships adds an emotional depth that sets Stardew Valley apart. Building friendships and even romancing certain characters feels natural and rewarding, adding a layer of emotional investment to the daily routines of farm life. The events and festivals throughout the year also contribute to a sense of community, making Pelican Town a place players are eager to return to season after season.

Stardew Valley's soundtrack, composed by ConcernedApe himself, is a masterpiece that complements the game's relaxing atmosphere. Each track perfectly captures the mood of different seasons and activities, enhancing the overall immersion and providing a comforting backdrop to the player's virtual life.

One of the game's strengths is its accessibility. Stardew Valley caters to a wide audience, from hardcore farming enthusiasts to casual gamers looking for a tranquil escape. The straightforward controls, intuitive mechanics, and the absence of a strict time limit allow players to enjoy the game at their own pace.

In conclusion, Stardew Valley is a triumph in indie game development, offering a timeless and enchanting experience that transcends its pixelated aesthetic. It is a celebration of the joy found in the simple things, from planting seeds and raising animals to forming connections with the virtual community. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or new to the world of simulation games, Stardew Valley is a heartwarming journey that will leave you with a sense of fulfillment and a genuine appreciation for the beauty of virtual farming life.

For my whole life, I have wanted to be a farmer, to live a simple life, grow plants and animals, and be part of a small town. When I play Stardew Valley, I get to live that dream in a small way. This game gets right to the essence of the real-life adventures of work, community, family, and the beauty of a simple life in harmony with nature. A great game in every possible way. Infinite/10

My favorite game of all time. I know that sounds silly, but hear me out. I first got the game on switch about 4 years ago, and I never thought that I would love a game so much I would purchase it on other platforms too. I usually don't. But this game is an exception. Playing Stardew Valley is an experience unlike any other, or at least one that I haven't been able to replicate many times. If you're unsure of this game, please give it another chance. There's so much to do in this game. I'm sure most people are aware of that, and although when you first play the game it might be confusing, it grows on you so much as you begin to explore the beautiful story and world this game has to offer. I can't even begin to explain the love I have for this game, and how much it means to me. Anyway, absolutely love this game. <3

This game will always mean the world to me. 
I bought an xbox one with my own money when I was 18, and it only had a few games on it. 
Minecraft, Skyrim, and Stardew Valley. 

Now I'm 26, 8 years have passed, and one thing is for sure, I still have all three of those games installed.
Stardew tickled my nostalgia bone while simultaneously overwhelming me with unseen content before I completed it, and even after grinding the achievements for 500+ hours, I still like to log on and pet the dog sometimes. 

I will always love this game, the community, the artwork, the music, and the memories. 🧡

Bit late making this review, but I realized I needed to do one.

I found this game one summer when I only had my laptop to game on as I was away from my home PC. A lot younger, and bummed out that I cannot play my high res games, I can't even remember how I stumbled upon this game and decided to buy it. Especially since at this time I would be very stingy with online purchases as everything had to go through my parents bank card. Nevertheless, I stumbled upon an absolute gem of a game that will forever remain in my heart.

Whats good about this game you may ask? Everything. It has an amazing balance of grinding, decorating, story, exploring etc. It really just has it all for me. As a kid I was in love with Animal Crossings, and a little later became obsessed with Minecraft. I feel like this is a beautifully crafted mixture of these two games, put into a masterfully artistic 2D world.

I spent many hours on this game and enjoyed it to the point of full completion. I can't wait for any updates that await as these updates will keep bringing me back to a wonderful and new experience with the same feeling of when I first played this game. Everything just feels so authentic and genuine. I would highly recommend this game to absolutely anyone and will rave about how amazing it is.

I'd also like to add how much I specifically loved the Ginger Island update. I love when games continue to update with amazing content such as that and I cannot wait for this upcoming 1.6 update. I will be sinking many more hours into this game when that arrives.

Thank you ConcernedApe.

There's so many good things about Stardew and I'd love to share my experience with you!
First of all, "Farming RPG", I sort of thought this game would be boring when I first heard about it because I was like "Well, just farming? That doesn't really sound that fun." But, it's nothing like that. Sure, farming is a part of the game but there's so much more to it. There's mining, relationship building, upgrading, customizing and there's so much more to it.

So, I'm originally an Xbox player (Probably like 300+ hours LOL) when it comes to Stardew, I've noticed that It's equally fun between Xbox and PC, at least I think so. When on Xbox, Fishing is a lot easier, I won't lie. But It's still fun regardless to try it on PC because I find that It's more challenging which makes it fun! 

The fact you can build relationships with the NPC's in this game is so cool, I love that you can make friends and relationships with the NPC's, you can marry them or date them, they can send you gifts and you can give them gifts and I think that's really cool. And not to mention, that you can emote and type in the chat when you're playing with your friends but you can also marry your friends that aren't NPC's, haha!

I also really love all of the customization with your character and other characters, I also love that this game is supportive of LGBTQ+ and you can marry/date people of the same gender, it's a really nice feature considering a lot of games aren't like that.

Overall, I would never hesitate to recommend Stardew Valley to anyone, it's seriously amazing.

The story of the game and the interaction with the characters is really nice. I decided to buy the game after playing the game for free on the internet and with the updates to the game, the game has really become more beautiful.

1. Crops can only ripen in the current season and there are only 28 days in a season. If this season does not ripen, the crops will all wither in the next season.
2. For crops such as grapes and hops that grow on the shelf, there must be a gap between each row when planting, otherwise the middle will not be taken. The shelf of such plants can be understood to be like a wall.
3. The wooden box on the door is a transport box, not a storage box. If you put things in, they will automatically be sold when you go to bed at night, but you can take out the things you throw away on the same day.
4. Every season, you should buy all the seeds you can buy in the Peier store. You should keep at least one for each crop. It is best to keep 5 for each quality. Then the sacrifice needs to be used.
5. Crops should be watered every day, not when it rains. It is advisable to plant the crops next to the pond to make it more convenient to get water.
6. Only wild seeds can be sown in winter and no other crops can be sown. Beehives do not produce honey in winter.
7. Prioritise building greenhouses so that crops can be grown in greenhouses in winter
8. Do not take tools in your hands when growing and picking vegetables, it is easy to hoe vegetables.
9. You can pick raspberries in the wild in spring and blackberries in autumn. It is worthless, but it is the most cost-effective thing to regain physical strength and health.
10. It is best to take the path of sacrifice to have a sense of achievement. After the sacrifice is slaughtered, everyone will come to celebrate. Joja supermarket will close. After completing a small sacrifice, there will be a movie theatre (but for full success, you need to go the joja supermarket membership route, but you will often complain that the work is not good, and the community centre will become a movie theatre)

Animals：
1. There is a small door between the chicken coop and the barn, and small animals cannot enter or exit when the door is closed.
2. Touching small animals can often increase friendship, so that the quality of the product is improved.
3. Build a chicken coop near the pond, and the ducks will come down to swim
4. Finish cutting the weeds. When the animals are raised, build another barn, and then the weeding will become hay that small animals can eat.
5. The biggest barn can be used to make wine, and the space is very large.
6. When you first discover dinosaur eggs, don't donate them to the museum. Put them in the chicken coop for hatching so you can hatch the little dinosaurs.
7. After going to the joja route, you can buy an automatic stroking machine from the joja supermarket. Only when you get the victim can you go down to the mine to open the treasure chest. There is a possibility that an automatic stroking machine will open. With this you can free your hands and no longer have to touch the small animals by hand.
8. Plant the grass under the fence, the small animals will not be able to finish eating and the grass will continue to grow.
9. Truffles are obtained from pigs. Truffle oil can be produced in an oil-producing machine. Truffle oil is very valuable.

Keeping fish：
1. Water fishing can be done in most places. To be precise, it should be possible to cast a rod.
2. Go to the beach to buy more shells. It is good to make money by selling shells at an early stage. After the bridge on the beach is repaired, corals and sea urchins will often be produced on the other side.
3. Fishing itself is not difficult. There are fish kings in every season. The most difficult is the fish king in spring.
4. Don't lose the joja cocaine you caught, you can give it to Sam.
5. Where Willie often fishes is a good fishing spot. I don't know if there's any basis for it, but it's right to fish with the old fisherman.
6. The crab cage needs to put bait (at first I put the crab cage without bait, but after a long time I found nothing abnormal...)

Mining：
1. First craft a marvellous ring that will emit light and can be used as a small flashlight.
2. Kill enough 1000 slime to unlock the slime ring and when you wear it you will no longer be attacked by slime.
3. The slime can be raised in the square and they will say hello
4. It is advisable to reopen the mine immediately after fainting, or you can find someone to retrieve the dropped items.
5. Usually don't throw away the stones you collect. You can use them as stairs. It will be very useful to go down to the 100th floor of the desert mine at that time.
6. Don't stupidly shoot the stones one by one. Using bombs can save time, but remember to stay away from them.
7. Dwarf scrolls have a fixed number of regeneration layers
8. Do not lose insect meat. You can make bait, but you can also make bait boxes.


NPC Article：
1. Do not go through the rubbish bin in front of the NPC, it will lose its favourability.
2. Each NPC can give gifts only twice a week. On the NPC's birthday the favourability of the gift will greatly increase (you can search Wikipedia to understand everyone's preferences and sending things you don't like will lose favourability)
3. The default CP is Haley + Alex, Abigail + Sebastian, Leah + Elliot, Penny + Sam, Maru + Harvey. Shane and Emily have no CP but Clint the blacksmith has a crush on Emily.
4. At least one NPC will be chosen first. Only NPCs with more than three stars will accept your invitation during the dance, otherwise they can only watch other people dance next to them.
5. If the NPC reaches eight stars, it will no longer rise. For the object with eight stars you need to buy flowers from Piel and ask ta to be your boyfriend/girlfriend.
6. Both male and female npc's can be raiders. This game accepts txl. The opposite sex is to give birth to a child and the same sex is to adopt a child.
7. Each npc has its own story. Although it is very interesting, it is recommended that everyone get 10 stars. They are all very kind.
8. Sewer Xiaohei can also get married and go home, you need to go to the desert to get an empty necklace
9. When entering the mine, there is a large stone on the right that can be smashed with a bomb or pickaxe (if it cannot be smashed, the quality of the pickaxe is not good enough). Dwarf NPCs live in it.
10. If the favourability with each male/female NPC reaches full level, the male shura field (large-scale jealousy scene) will be triggered when entering the tavern and the female shura field will be triggered when going to Haley's house. It can be avoided by bringing a rabbit's feet, so that everyone is in harmony.

other：
1. The three curved points in the ground are worms. You can dig them out with a hoe. Many cultural relics in the museum come from here.
2. Develop a good habit of watching TV every day. Most recipes come from watching cooking programmes.
3. Press shift to buy items 5 times
4. Dressing table can hold clothes
5. In spring, green onions will grow in the open field under Mani's house, where there are bridges and rivers (I only learnt this after playing for a few years...)
6. After a certain earthquake, a hot spring swimming pool will appear above Robin's house. Taking a bath can restore your strength.
7. You can go home at two o'clock, no need to lie in bed.
8. There are two game consoles in the tavern. After clearing two mini-games you can take the game console. You will also get a coke machine when you go to the Joja route.
9. After collecting all kinds of scarecrows you will get a super scarecrow from the Scarecrow Association, which has a wider coverage.

This very hypnotic fun game starts as a farming game, mixed with a wild soap opera, mixed with the fighting levels and style of World of Warcraft yet uses lower system requirements. Level up your weapons, crafting,  and armor as Human, Dwarf, and Goblin squads battle in underground mines. Facebook and Reddit say it is super popular. I first played it as an app, but switched to PC. PC is the best way to play as it saves the game online which the app game does not, and gives you online multiplayer options the app game does not. In addition it has more plot and updates on the Steam games PC version. I am glad I tried this one as it lives up to the fan club hype, and like Albion Online you can play on phone, Chromebook, Switch, and PC format and offline format as well. It fixes the problems of many other games.

Stardew Valley is an amazing game. The graphics and gameplay work together to make an incredibly comfy and fun experience, and the fact that the game is still getting support to this day is incredible, even as ConcernedApe is working on his next game. If you've played the game many times and are looking for something more, I would highly recommend checking out the modding community around this game, as they have added hundreds of new villagers, crops, and areas for you to experience, with the release of 1.6 and the improved modding tools hopefully encouraging even more people to contribute. Thank you ConcernedApe for making this magnificent game.
